message: As I'm typing this, the show "Net@Night" on this network, the TWiT Network, is being faded out.  Since the debut of the now-popular show on TWiT, Amber and Leo each week have gone through the web news of the week with an amazing view on it unique from almost anyone else on the internet.  It is a sad fate for this show so many of us enjoyed and watched.  The replacement for it is a new show with the name "The Social Hour".  As much as that show will be enjoyed.  It is a sad thing but Leo will no longer be on be hosting that show.  Instead, the job is given to Amber and Sarah to bring us the internet news and talk to a start-up or something else interesting on that show.  It is sad but we should let Net@Night Rest in Peace.
I'm sure the new show will be great. Amber and Sarah; What's not to love!
To new beginnings
@rcs yeah but still...
While I will enjoy both of them, Leo always gives a show an added element.
Yes. Indeed it is a great show. TWiT will continue with The Social Hour being some sort of replacement. TWiT On!!
Long live The Social Hour!
I was confused,sorry bout that!
@dellak you mean a replacement for Net@Night?
While Sarah is one of my favorite, I don't think this would be a replacement for TWIT
It's just evolution,  can't expect Leo to do everything.   Loved Net@Nite though it was where I found twitter and facebook in the early daze you know way way back in 06

I agree, with the growth of the TWiT network you can't expect Leo to do all these shows and still innovate so onto the Social Hour. Sarah and Amber have been great in Leo's absence so I will keep downloading the podcast. Actually it came down this week without my having to do anything. Onward and upward.
@wally2you I know but isn't Net@Night one of their most popular shows?  What will happen after the transition to the Social Hour is done?
@jeremyheslop Indeed, I think because he knows best of all of them that this is not really serious, and there are more serious stuff in the universe - his is the fun break :)
The end was near, when net@nite began recording on Tuesday afternoons!
@superpc it will be interesting to see however it is fun to see Leo building this network.

@Arnold have loaded under the same feed as Net@Night.  Thats how it worked for me.  If you were subscrbed to Net@Night then you are/should be automatically suscribed to The Social Hour. Otherwise go here to subscribe: http://twit.tv/tsh
I still don't see The Social Hour in iTunes under TWiT shows.
I just watched TSH episode 1. I little to much Twitter talk in the beginning. I think it will get there. Sarah and Amber are smart girls.
I enjoyed the conversation between the two women.  And I was glad to hear Sarah explain Color; I was wondering what the point of that app was.
I wish TSH would be Video podcast
Things change @superpc , you will notice more of the shows with out Leo. Leo is looking to retire in the next 5-10, so dont be surprised if you see him do less and less

@LouisM Has Leo actually said he is looking at retiring? I think the TWiT network of shoes are excellent. Is there an app that will allow me to "download" these podcasts on my HTC Desire Android phone?
@robinjuste You could try this one: https://market.android.com/details?id=com.mediafly.android.video.twit
Soon its RIP convore - the amount of Twit conversations are dying out :)
@HateBadDesign Thank you for suggesting the TWiT Android app. Just what I need as I don't do any other podcasts but TWiT.
@HateBadDesign I hope those behind convore have enough runway to hang in because in the long run this could be a great tool for almost everyone. This could be the next big thing!

@HateBadDesign We're not going anywhere, we're growing every day :)  Some groups get bigger and a few get smaller.  One thing we are noticing though is that private groups are rocking more than public groups are.
@ericflo maybe a little more promotion of public groups that might have broad appeal. e.g. http://convore.com/realestate substitute realestate with any broad root word or words.
@craigshipp Yeah that's a good idea
@craigshipp Here's something I just added a few minutes ago, trending groups, showing public groups with very recent activity https://convore.com/discover/trending/ That should help a little.
yep, there's more to convore than convore.com/twit

I think there's a lot of crossover between the shows on the Twit Network and a realignment may be necessary. It's not a bad thing if that happens though. Increasingly TWIG talks more about Facebook than Google for instance.

@peterkonnecke original idea for TWIG is to cover 'cloud' news / businesses. they went with google in the name just because 'twig' is a catchy name... personally i just kinda wish they're less political and more technical in twig...
@unwrangle agree ... I guess presenters have to be careful to cover themselves and that always gets mired in political mess ... say as it is ... and get on with the tech stuff is what I say
Im sure Leo is having more responsibilities with the growth theyve seen
What happened to this weeks show? The social hour that is
@jwking i think it's after tomorrow's tnt, check the calendar...
Wednesday 4pm Petaluma time (if you wish to view it live)
Ah thought it was on Monday's no worries thx
Its usually on mondays
I think it's a great decision from a leadership perspective, whoever made it. Leo can't and shouldn't do it all! There will be more great ideas to come, I'm sure. They run a great ship over there.
It has been the same after leo left - (except when Amber explains why she isn't nude on the show *g*)
I think I like the old format! Web 2.0 start-ups talking about their projects.
I was worried that they were not going to interview startup etc, but it looks like they still will. The startup interviews were my favourite part of n@N
@HateBadDesign Which episode was that ?!?

@Jude Actually it was the live show before they started the last one. Someone on twitter had remarked that when Ambers bangs fell a certain way they had covered the straps of her dress, so it looked like she was wearing nothing. She was quick to point out she was, and always would be wearing clothes on twit shows ;)
Although I like Sarah I really do not care for this new format. I know Leo can't do everything but that was one of the reasons why I was a fan of net@night. This is one podcast I will not download.
yea to be honest net at night lost its luster long time ago
@lancebailey except Amber introduced me to convore!
I would like the show better if Sarah "hosted" the show and prompted Amber to speak a little bit more.  A good example would be how Leo is Paul's foil on Windows Weekly...
@HateBadDesign LOL, sounds like a clip for the highlight reel!
I like Amber
@kyserboy345 what's not to like!
@darrenkeith3 bummer! what about the new format do you not enjoy?
@Jude have you watched the last few shows? hopefully it's more balanced!

I give credit to the Twit network!  It is a great idea.  And even though I don't have his budget, I have been doing a Pod/video cast called Technology With Mike at techwithmike.com which has new Web start-ups come on and talk about their projects/companies.  Stop by and check it out and send me all feedback good or bad.  Anyways, Leo is doing an awesome job!
